curriculum_stages.name: Basic Hit/Stand
curriculum_stages.description: The agent learns the fundamental actions of hitting and standing. It should learn basic card counting to determine when to hit or stand based on its current hand value and the dealer's upcard. Focus is on maximizing the probability of winning with only these two actions.

curriculum_stages.name: Introducing Double Down
curriculum_stages.description: The agent now learns when to strategically use the 'Double Down' action. This involves understanding the odds and expected value when having a strong hand (e.g., 11, or soft 17/18 against a low dealer upcard) and capitalizing on these favorable situations. This stage builds upon the previous understanding of hit/stand decisions, adding an element of risk-reward analysis.

curriculum_stages.name: Split Decision
curriculum_stages.description: This stage trains the agent on when to correctly split pairs. The focus is on understanding the situations where splitting improves the overall expected return (e.g., splitting 8s against almost any dealer upcard, splitting Aces). The agent must learn when splitting gives a significant advantage and when to avoid it.

curriculum_stages.name: Full Blackjack Strategy
curriculum_stages.description: The agent now has access to all available actions and must learn a complete Blackjack strategy. This involves mastering the optimal use of hit, stand, double down, and split based on the player's hand, the dealer's upcard, and the rules of the game. The agent refines all earlier learned heuristics, adjusting them for edge cases to optimize long-term winnings. This stage requires sophisticated exploration to achieve the target win rate.
